head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #35

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #35 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Sunday 21
Cloudy weather, wind this day at ESE & blows fresh for the afternoon, and all night accompanied with Sleet[.]
Monday 22
Men employed making oakum, sinnet, Jonas repairing chests & rudder hood &c wind this day at SW blows fresh & frequent Showers of rain – make the quny 13¼ oakum[.]
Tuesday 23
Men employed cutting wood fore part of this day – afternoon go to the mink encrease the purchase on her – & slew her about a foot the water still continues low – wind this day from the Westward[.]
Wednesday 24

I this morning had some words with Jacob Hammond Richd McGregor, & John Morrison, for not being at work at an early hour, they are very insolent Morrison & I have a scuffle – McGregor swears he will not cut more than a cord of wood – Jacob says he can cut fore wood enough to warm himself, & that his time is out on the 5th June next – wind this day at NE & light[.]
Thursday 25

Fore & latter part of this night snows – throughout the day are employed at the mink, succeed in moving her about 10 feet, it blows fresh in squalls from the NW all this day – carried away the Nancys peak halyards twice, in getting the mink off.
Friday 26
Fore & latter part of this day all hands employed at the Mink, but to no purpose, wind at NW & cold raw weather[.]
Saturday 27

Fore & latter part of this day hard at work at the Mink succeed in moving her, after placing skids under her bilge heave all taught & make every secure – wind this day at West, & towards night have much snow – the water today became very high about noon[.]
Sunday 28
Wind all this day at West & cold weather cloudy[.]
Monday 29

Wind this day at East which makes the water low, find the bay on which the mink is entirely froze over – men cutting wood killed 2 pigs for our consumption Wg 325 – 192 133 – Cloudy & looks like more snow[.]
Tuesday 30
Wind this day from the Eastward, men employed cutting wood – snows all day & ice is formed out to the Nancy[.]
Wednesday
All hands employed at the mink, succeed in moving her about 9 feet an end – this night is a most intense one at frost[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
